definition[0]: a type of fabric conditioner (=liquid for making clothes feel soft), sold in the UK
definition[1]: a feeling of being physically relaxed and satisfied, so that nothing is hurting you, making you feel too hot or cold etc
example[0]: I dress for comfort, not fashion.
example[1]: Alan was very reluctant to leave the warmth and comfort of the fire.
example[2]: Now you can watch your favorite movies in the comfort of your own home.
example[3]: All our sports shoes are designed for comfort and performance.
example[4]: The temperature was too low for comfort.
example[5]: Upstairs is a more intimate bar where guests can relax in comfort.
definition[2]: if someone or something gives you comfort, they make you feel calmer, happier, or more hopeful after you have been worried or unhappy
example[6]: Whenever he was upset, he would turn to her for comfort and advice.
example[7]: a book which offers comfort and help to the parents of children with cancer
example[8]: The knowledge that Cara was safe gave him some comfort.
example[9]: My faith has been a source of great comfort over the years.
example[10]: He drew comfort from her warm support.
example[11]: You can take some comfort in the fact that you did your best.
example[12]: It was no comfort to think he might be as frightened as she was.
example[13]: Well, if it’s any comfort, I don’t think he’ll try again.
definition[3]: someone or something that helps you feel calmer, happier, or more hopeful after you have been worried or unhappy
example[14]: It’s a comfort to know there’s someone to keep an eye on the kids.
example[15]: Louisa’s been a great comfort to me since Mary died.
definition[4]: a way of living in which you have all the money and possessions that you need or want
example[16]: He was used to a life of comfort.
example[17]: When Dad died, he left us both enough to live in comfort for the rest of our lives.
heading[0]: – Meaning 2: if someone or something gives you comfort, they make you feel calmer, happier, or more hopeful after you have been worried or unhappy
example[18]: The family has taken comfort from the support of friends.
example[19]: Economists have been quick to draw comfort from the latest figures.
example[20]: He had been through a similar experience and she found comfort in that.
example[21]: Volunteers are available to offer comfort and advice.
example[22]: It was impossible to give her any comfort.
example[23]: Religious belief can bring comfort during times of stress.
example[24]: Talking about your problems may provide some comfort.
example[25]: People come to us seeking comfort and guidance.
example[26]: Your letters have been a great comfort to me.
example[27]: The tax changes will provide cold comfort to people living on a pension.
example[28]: He tried to find some words of comfort that would help her.
example[29]: Some people eat as a source of comfort.
example[30]: ‘You’re no worse than the rest, ’ the football coach said, trying to offer me a crumb of comfort.
example[31]: If it’s any comfort, you very nearly passed the exam.
example[32]: I find pasta and cheese is a great comfort food.
definition[5]: to make someone feel less worried, unhappy, or upset, for example by saying kind things to them or touching them
example[33]: Within hours of the news, Helen arrived to comfort her heartbroken friend.
example[34]: He longed to take her in his arms and comfort her.
example[35]: Mr Aston’s father was last night being comforted by relatives.
example[36]: She comforted herself with the thought that it would soon be spring.
